questions.question: What is the portfolio-site project about?
questions.notes: Direct lookup — both should handle fine

questions.question: What language is the pokemon-api written in?
questions.notes: Single fact retrieval

questions.question: What does the crypto-web-component do?
questions.notes: Direct lookup from one repo README

questions.question: What framework does the shopping-list-t3 project use?
questions.notes: Single repo, single fact

questions.question: What is the github-portfolio-mcp-server project?
questions.notes: Direct README lookup for a specific project

questions.question: What programming language is the koolo project written in?
questions.notes: Single fact — Go project

questions.question: What is the FHIRServerAPI project about?
questions.notes: Direct lookup — healthcare/FHIR server

questions.question: What deployment platform does the github-portfolio-mcp-server use?
questions.notes: Single fact retrieval — Railway

questions.question: What does the duckracenamegenerator project do?
questions.notes: Direct README lookup

questions.question: What does the rag-vs-agentic project demonstrate?
questions.notes: Direct README lookup for this very project

questions.question: Which projects use Angular, and how do they differ in purpose?
questions.notes: Requires finding multiple repos, comparing them

questions.question: How does the developer's experience with Kotlin differ between the NasaPictureOfTheDay and TodoApp projects?
questions.notes: Cross-document comparison requiring both READMEs

questions.question: What backend technologies has the developer used across all projects?
questions.notes: Requires aggregating info from multiple repos

questions.question: Compare the authentication approaches used in MEANAuthApp vs MEANAuthAppAngular.
questions.notes: Must retrieve and compare two specific repos

questions.question: Which project has the most stars, and what is it about?
questions.notes: Agent can use live GitHub API; RAG only sees static READMEs

questions.question: How do the NasaPictureOfTheDay Android and Kotlin projects compare in their tech stacks?
questions.notes: Two READMEs needed; agent can fetch both directly

questions.question: Which projects use TypeScript, and what are they used for?
questions.notes: Must scan multiple repos for TypeScript usage

questions.question: What cloud hosting or deployment platforms has the developer used across their projects?
questions.notes: Aggregation across multiple repos — Vercel, Railway, Firebase, etc.

questions.question: Does the developer have any AI, LLM, or machine learning projects? What are they?
questions.notes: Requires broad portfolio scan; agent can search semantically

questions.question: What web component projects has the developer built, and what technologies do they use?
questions.notes: Must identify web-component repos and compare them

questions.question: Which projects use a database, and what kind of database does each use?
questions.notes: Cross-repo aggregation — SQL, NoSQL, vector DB, etc.

questions.question: What should I look at if I want to see this developer's best work?
questions.notes: Subjective — agent can check stars, recency, descriptions

questions.question: Is this developer experienced enough for a full-stack role?
questions.notes: Requires synthesizing across many repos and technologies

questions.question: What areas could this developer improve in based on their portfolio?
questions.notes: Requires broad analysis — agent can explore, RAG gets noisy

questions.question: Is this developer more of a frontend or backend engineer?
questions.notes: Judgment call needing breadth of project analysis

questions.question: What unique strengths does this developer bring to a software team?
questions.notes: Open-ended synthesis requiring portfolio-wide view

questions.question: Would this developer be a good fit for a Python-heavy backend role?
questions.notes: Requires inferring skill depth from project evidence

questions.question: Which project in this portfolio demonstrates the most architectural sophistication?
questions.notes: Subjective ranking — agent can reason across multiple; RAG may pick one

questions.question: How would you describe this developer's approach to mobile development?
questions.notes: Inference from Android/Kotlin/Compose projects

questions.question: Based on this portfolio, what kind of engineering problems does this developer enjoy solving?
questions.notes: High inference — tests ability to synthesize personality from work
